summary: This is an email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY, coordinating the copying of discovery materials onto hard drives for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel. It references multiple productions of evidence, logistical challenges, and the involvement of various personnel.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case; the email discusses preparing discovery materials (productions) for her defense counsel.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: The sender of the email, working for the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, coordinating the complex process of copying discovery drives for the defense.

connections.description: The paralegal is coordinating with M, who is going into the office to handle the physical copying of discovery drives.
The paralegal works for the prosecuting office (U.S. Attorney's Office) that is building the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Evidence Sent to Maxwell at MDC
events.description: A hard drive copy of materials was sent to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Awaiting Drive from PAE
events.description: As of this date, the paralegal had not yet received a drive containing parts of Production 7 from an external entity (PAE).

events.title: Planned Drive Copying Operation
events.description: The email outlines the plan for M to begin a multi-day process of copying discovery materials onto drives for defense counsel, starting the next day.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing a massive volume of discovery (multiple numbered productions) for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in late November 2020.
The process involved copying materials from a shared drive, a hard drive copy made for Maxwell at MDC, and expected materials from an external contractor (PAE).
The email notes that all 'highly confidential items' had been removed from the materials being produced to the defense.
The copying job was anticipated to be a multi-day process due to the volume of data, specifically referencing that loading the 'Sixth Production' alone took many hours.
The correspondence reveals logistical coordination between a paralegal, an in-office colleague (M), and potentially other staff to fulfill discovery obligations.
